content.question: Which mathematical expression can be used to explain why buffer 2 and buffer 3 have the same <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the log of the fraction 0.200 over 0.200 equals the log of the fraction 0.100 over 0.100, which equals the log of 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>log</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.200</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.200</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>log</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.100</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.100</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>log</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the negative log of K sub w, minus the negative log of K sub b, which equals p K sub a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mtext>log</mtext></mrow><mtext>(</mtext><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>w</mi></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>[</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mtext>log</mtext></mrow><mtext>(</mtext><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></msub><mtext>)]</mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext>p</mtext><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="0.200 molar equals 2 times 0.100 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.200</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>×</mo><mtext>(</mtext><mn>0.100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="0.200 molar minus 0.200 molar equals 0.100 molar minus 0.100 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.200</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>0.200</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>0.100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the log of the fraction 0.200 over 0.200 equals the log of the fraction 0.100 over 0.100, which equals the log of 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>log</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.200</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.200</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>log</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.100</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.100</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>log</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
